Description: Papyrus: 2 lines of Coptic text on one side, written against the fibres (verso). Greek protocol on the other side, written along the fibres (recto). Mounted with EA 75306, 75305, 75304, 75303, 75301.
Curator's comments: On the Byzantine Greek protocol: A. Delattre, 'La reutilisation des protocoles aux epoques byzantines et arabe', J. Frosen et al. (eds) Proceedings of the 24th International Congress of Papyrology, Helsinki, 1-7 August, 2004, 2007, p. 219
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (118110) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/118110)
Clackson 2008 / It is our father who writes: orders from the monastery of Apollo at Bawit
